solution_line_template: A year has {months_per_year} months. If 1 month costs ${cost_per_month}, then a year will cost ${months_per_year} * {cost_per_month} = $<<{months_per_year}*{cost_per_month}={cost_per_year_no_discount}>>{cost_per_year_no_discount} per year without an annual subscription

If the annual subscription has a {discount_percent}% discount then you would pay ${cost_per_year_no_discount} * (1-{discount_percent}%) = $<<{cost_per_year_no_discount}*(1-{discount_percent}*{percent_factor})={final_annual_cost}>>{final_annual_cost} for the annual subscription
